description: Universal Task to Manage Docker Containers

fields.hint: Assign a name to the container
fields.label: Container Name
fields.name: name

fields.hint: Automatically remove the container when it exits
fields.label: Remove
fields.name: remove

fields.hint: Environment variables to set inside the container
fields.label: Container Environment Variables
fields.name: envarray

fields.hint: Ports to bind inside the container
fields.label: Container Port Mapping
fields.name: portarray

fields.hint: Force the removal of a running container or image
fields.label: Force
fields.name: force

fields.hint: Controls messages issued from the Universal Task
fields.label: Logging Level
fields.name: loglevel

name: Docker Container
script:
#!/opt/universal/python3.6/bin/python3
# --
#         Origins: Stonebranch
#          Author: Colin Cocksedge colin.cocksedge@stonebranch.com
#            Date: 07-Oct-2019
#
#    Copyright (c) Stonebranch, 2018.  All rights reserved.
#
#         Purpose: Universal Task for Docker Containers
#
version = "1.0"
#           Version History:    1.0     CCO     07-Oct-2019      Initial Version
# --

# -- Main Logic Function
def main():
    ScriptSetup()  # -- Import Required Modules, Setup Logging Format, Set Variables
    if args.function == "Run":
        RunContainer()  # -- Run The Docker Container
    if args.function == "Create":
        CreateContainer()  # -- Create The Docker Container
    if args.function == "Stop":
        StopContainer()  # -- Stop The Docker Container
    if args.function == "Start":
        StartContainer()  # -- Start The Docker Container
    if args.function == "RemoveContainer":
        RemoveContainer()  # -- Remove The Docker Container


# --

# -- Import Required Modules, Setup Logging Format, Set Variables
def ScriptSetup():
    # -- Import required python modules
    import argparse
    import logging
    import sys
    import docker
    import ast

    global logging
    global sys
    global docker
    global ast
    global argparse
    # -- Set Variables from Universal Task Form or Command Line Input
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Purpose : Manage Docker Containers")
    # ## --> Capture Universal Task Form Variables Here
    parser.add_argument(
        "--function",
        default="${ops_docker_function}",
        help="Select the required docker function",
        choices=["Run", "RemoveContainer", "Create", "Start", "Stop"],
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--image", default="${ops_docker_image}", help="Docker image name"
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--name", default="${ops_docker_name}", help="Assign a name to the container"
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--hostname",
        default="${ops_docker_hostname}",
        help="Optional hostname for the container",
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--command", default="${ops_docker_command}", help="Optional container command"
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--envarray",
        default='{${_convertArrayFieldVariable("ops_docker_envarray",":",",","\"","\"")}}',
        help="Specify container environment variables (--envarray '{""var1"":""value1"",""var2"":""value2""}')"
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--portarray",
        default='{${_convertArrayFieldVariable("ops_docker_portarray",":",",","\"","\"")}}',
        help="Specify container mapped ports (--portarray '{""port"":""value1"",""port"":""value2""}')"
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--remove",
        default="${ops_docker_remove}",
        type=str2bool,
        help="Automatically remove the container when it exits",
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--detach",
        default="${ops_docker_detach}",
        type=str2bool,
        help="Run container in the background",
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--force",
        default="${ops_docker_force}",
        type=str2bool,
        help="Force the removal of a running container or image",
    )
    # ## -->
    parser.add_argument(
        "--loglevel",
        default="${ops_docker_loglevel}",
        help="Controls messages issued from the Script",
        choices=["None", "Info", "Debug", "Warning", "Critical"],
    )
    global args
    args = parser.parse_args()
    # -- Setup Logging
    numeric_level = getattr(logging, args.loglevel.upper(), None)
    logging.basicConfig(
        format="%(asctime)-15s - %(levelname)-8s - %(message)s", level=numeric_level
    )
    # -- Print Paramater Values
    logging.debug(
        "Executing version {0} with the following parameters : {1}".format(
            version, args
        )
    )


# --

# ## --> Functions Go Here

# -- Run The Docker Container
def RunContainer():
    logging.info(
        "Run Docker Container {0} from image {1}".format(args.name, args.image)
    )
    # Check if Container Exists
    if CheckContainer(args.name, True) == True:
        print("Container {0} Already Exists. No Action Taken.".format(args.name))
        sys.exit(1)
    if str(args.envarray[1][:1]) != "$":
        envarray = ast.literal_eval(args.envarray)
    else:
        envarray = {}
    if str(args.portarray[1][:1]) != "$":
        portarray = ast.literal_eval(args.portarray)
    else:
        portarray = {}
    if len(args.command) != 0 and str(args.command[1][:1]) == "$":
        args.command = ""
    if str(args.name[1][:1]) == "$":
        args.name = ""
    if str(args.hostname[1][:1]) == "$":
        args.hostname = ""
    client = docker.from_env()
    try:
        container = client.containers.run(
            args.image,
            args.command,
            detach=args.detach,
            environment=envarray,
            ports=portarray,
            name=args.name,
            hostname=args.hostname,
            remove=args.remove,
            stderr=True,
        )
    except:
        logging.error("Create Container {0}".format(sys.exc_info()))
        sys.exit(1)
    logging.info("{0}".format(container))
    ID = str(container)
    print(ID[-11:-1])


# --
# -- Create The Docker Container
def CreateContainer():
    logging.info(
        "Creating Docker Container {0} from image {1}".format(args.name, args.image)
    )
    # Check if Container Exists
    if CheckContainer(args.name, True) == True:
        print("Container {0} Already Exists. No Action Taken.".format(args.name))
        sys.exit(1)
    if str(args.envarray[1][:1]) != "$":
        envarray = ast.literal_eval(args.envarray)
    else:
        envarray = {}
    if str(args.portarray[1][:1]) != "$":
        portarray = ast.literal_eval(args.portarray)
    else:
        portarray = {}
    options = ""
    if len(args.command) != 0 and str(args.command[1][:1]) == "$":
        args.command = ""
    if str(args.name[1][:1]) == "$":
        args.name = ""
    if str(args.hostname[1][:1]) == "$":
        args.hostname = ""
    client = docker.from_env()
    try:
        container = client.containers.create(
            args.image,
            args.command,
            environment=envarray,
            ports=portarray,
            name=args.name,
            hostname=args.hostname,
        )
    except:
        logging.error("Create Container {0}".format(sys.exc_info()))
        sys.exit(1)
    logging.info("{0}".format(container))
    ID = str(container)
    print(ID[-11:-1])


# --
# -- Stop The Docker Container
def StopContainer():
    logging.info("Stopping Docker Container {0}".format(args.name))
    # Check if Container is RUNNING
    if CheckContainer(args.name, False) == False:
        print("Container {0} is Not Running. No Action Taken.".format(args.name))
        sys.exit(0)
    # Stop Container
    client = docker.APIClient()
    try:
        container = client.stop(args.name)
    except:
        logging.error("Stop Container {0}".format(sys.exc_info()))
        sys.exit(1)
    logging.info("Container {0} STOPPED".format(args.name))
    print(container)


# --
# -- Start The Docker Container
def StartContainer():
    logging.info("Starting Docker Container {0}".format(args.name))
    # Check if Container is RUNNING
    if CheckContainer(args.name, False) == True:
        print("Container {0} is Already Running. No Action Taken.".format(args.name))
        sys.exit(0)
    # Start Container
    client = docker.APIClient()
    try:
        container = client.start(args.name)
    except:
        logging.error("Start Container {0}".format(sys.exc_info()))
        sys.exit(1)
    logging.info("Container {0} STARTED".format(args.name))
    print(container)


# --
# -- Remove The Docker Container
def RemoveContainer():
    logging.info("Removing Docker Container {0}".format(args.name))
    # Check if Container Exists
    if CheckContainer(args.name, True) == False:
        print("Container {0} Not Found. No Action Taken.".format(args.name))
        sys.exit(0)
    # Remove Container
    client = docker.APIClient()
    try:
        container = client.remove_container(args.name, force=args.force)
    except:
        logging.error("Remove Container {0}".format(sys.exc_info()))
        sys.exit(1)
    logging.info("Container {0} Removed".format(args.name))
    print(container)


# --
# -- Check if Container Active or Exists
def CheckContainer(name, active):
    dict = {"name": name}
    client = docker.from_env()
    container = client.containers.list(filters=dict, all=active)
    if len(container) == 0:
        return False
    else:
        return True


# --
# -- Convert String to Boolean
def str2bool(v):
    if v.lower() in ("true"):
        return True
    elif v.lower() in ("false"):
        return False
    else:
        return False


# --
# -- Execute
main()
